summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 among law enforcement personnel and prosecutors regarding the organization of interview materials and the status of outstanding investigative tasks for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses saving interview notes, creating witness folders, pending FBI 302 reports, processing video evidence, and arranging contact with a key individual.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case and investigation, referred to as 'Maxwell' in the email chain regarding outstanding items.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to searches of his devices which identified highly confidential items.

events.title: IME Interview
events.description: Interview notes from this date were among the materials being organized and saved to a shared drive.

events.title: Indirect Contact Made
events.description: Law enforcement made indirect contact with an individual (name redacted) who is aware she needs to be spoken to about the case going to trial. She agreed to call after the new year.

keyFacts: Investigators were organizing interview notes from mid-2020 (July and August) into witness folders on a shared drive for the Maxwell case.
FBI 302 reports documenting highly confidential items found on Jeffrey Epstein's devices were still in process and expected to be completed by the new year.
FBI CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) was still processing video files from evidence materials, with completion also expected in the new year.
Indirect contact was made with a key individual who agreed to schedule a call with prosecutors after the new year regarding the upcoming trial.
The correspondence shows active case management and evidence processing in late December 2020, shortly before Maxwell's trial.
